Detailed Description

Represents a map of all application settings in memory which can be loaded from or saved to an XML document.

Internally, all data is stored in a live XML document in memory and is flushed to disk when Save() is called.

To reset the settings object, Defaults() can be called, or Load() to load the settings from disk.

Note that a settings object is not always tied to the SettingsFile. This allows you to create new temporary settings objects and play with their values without modifying settings on the live application. You can then Merge them back into a main settings object (this is how OptionsDialog works).

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Settings::Settings (  ) 

Initializes the base settings with the default values.

Load() has not been called at this point. To load settings from the SettingsFile use Load.

See also:
Load

Returns:
whether data was successfully loaded from disk.

Here is the call graph for this function:

void Settings::Merge ( const Settings &  other  ) 

Merges the current settings object with another, modifying the objects contents.

This will overwrite any settings that other has but this does not, and will leave all settings that this object has intact if they are not defined in other

Implementation note: this only works at the properties level of the root node of the XML file. Child elements will be ignored. This is not by design but by incomplete implementation.

bool Settings::Save (  )  const

Saves the current object to disk as an XML file located at SettingsFile.

Returns:
whether the object was saved to disk.

wxString Settings::SettingsFile (  )  const [private]

Returns the file name of the settings file on disk.

The path name should be returned by Application::GetSettingsPath.
